title: Love it, but key part not working (for me!)
comment: Got this so that I could hook up to my Raspberry Pi running raspbmc with my Nexus 7.  First impressions were brilliant, when using the remote to control what I could see on the TV from the Pi.    But where it is letting me down is that I want to be able to control my music library from the remote, so I can sit in one room and start up the music which XMBC has in it library.  Unfortunately, none of the tracks in the library appear on the remote; I can see artists and genres, but no tracks.  So I can't start up a playlist directly from the remote.  Other xbmc remotes DO see the track library, so there is nothing wrong with the XBMC setup that I have.  But the other remotes are nowhere near as nice to use as this one, so I'd really like to get this remote working properly.  Hopefully an update will make this work nicely soon and I can give it the five stars it deserves!

title: Works GREAT!
comment: Tip for 11.0 Eden users.  Statically assign the IP address to the machine XBMC is running on, and then explicitly define that IP address in xbmc remote.  Change the port to something OTHER than 80, or 8080, like 9999.  Displays album art, and if you turn the phone horizontal you can switch to the video, music, pictures, etc channels easily.  Works great on my Sprint LG Optimus S with Ice Cream Sandwich.

title: So much potential on a tablet
comment: I've, perhaps cruelly, only given 3 stars. The app is great, as is XBMC as a whole. I'm using this app on my tablet, and it does work, save of the periodic message saying it can't connect. It's clear of course (both from the description and from using it) that this isn't optimised for a tablet. Which is a shame, as there is so, so much potential for this app to be the centre of your Home Media Centre. It does a pretty good job of it anyway, but, for example, better playlist management for when listening to music, more tag info, eg ratings on the remote screen etc, and 'always up' controls things like that would make this a formidable combination. Hope something new comes along from the team soon!

I was going to minus a point because despite setting the app up to not fall asleep and kill the wifi connection it does and so you have to reconnect but I suspect that the issue is with my GNex rather than the app. LOVE the scrolling texts when you get SMS!
